nodes.bodyText:
What I don't get is why won't we just use RSQL on getArtifacts endpoint instead of creating entire new endpoint. DA needs to prepare request anyway.
RSQL that should be equivalent example is: q=identifier=like=group:*:version;artifactQuality=in=(DELETED,BLACKLISTED,NEW...);targetRepository.repositoryType==MAVEN
If you don't want to use =in= you can group multiple ORs like this: q=identifier=like=group:*:version;(artifactQuality==NEW,artifactQuality==TEMPORARY...);targetRepository.repositoryType==NPM
RSQL will create just one query to DB.

I have other question. Is it necessary for the endpoint to return whole Artifact? Isn't just subset of the data needed? For example, does DA need Build or TargetRepository?
I belive this endpoint should be really optimized.

@michalovjan  I believe that the new endpoint was suggested because of optimization as Petr describes in his doc https://docs.engineering.redhat.com/display/JP/Design%3A+Limit+usage+of+Brew+pull -> (to avoid frequent rsql parsing). @pkocandr is that right?
@janinko I am afraid I do not know what exactly DA needs from the Artifact. I can discuss this with Petr in more detail to crop the unnecessary data.

@dominikbrazdil @michalovjan Yes, the concern was raised by @jbartece and it will definitely help.
@dominikbrazdil AFAIK DA currently needs only list of versions and in the future it will need also the artifact quality, so I would add it right away. The result would be just a map version -> quality.  @janinko Correct?

This endpoint should be optimized as much as possible. Using the generic endpoint with RSQL is not a good option. It will be heavily used.
I second Honza's point, if it needs to return the whole artifact. ArtifactRef should be sufficient or possibly we could even create a new DTO entity with just id, identifier and ArtifactQuality.
I still think that RSQL parsing is not a performance issue but with Honza's suggestion, there is need for a new endpoint anyway.
It is definitely worse than without RSQL, so there is no point in parsing the string 100 000+ times a day.
AFAIK DA does not need to know id of the artifacts. Or is this "in the future" thing? @janinko

nodes.bodyText: I think there is not need to have the results in order. DA will order the results by itself, based on the best matching version.
Alright, didn't know that.

Is there a particular reason to surround the identifier with '%'?
If you'd asked for "org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001" specifically. You could potentially get 3 artifacts (or more):

org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001
org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001:sources
org.jboss.pnc:pnc:jar:2.0.0.GA-redhat-00001:javadocs

Well I thought that if the endpoint input is the identifier "pattern" then it should behave as LIKE functionality all the time. But if the case is more that it will be used for specific version calls then it should be probably based only on "*" present in the pattern.
The queries for the identifier MUST NEVER have "%" at the begining, so we can utilize index prefix search in DB. Otherwise the DB would have to do full scan over the whole table.
OK, so I will leave only the 'replace' part and DA will specify by "*" whenever it will need to search all identifiers that match the pattern.
ArtifactInfoPage.class?
left imports
left imports
Do we have artifact type (MVN/NPM) easily available? I guess we know it from the context, but I think that we could have it here so we know how to parse the identifier.

nodes.bodyText: Why are all the parameters optional? Wouldn't we always want to specify at least the identifier? And I would say repoType too.
@pkocandr What parameters will be used at all times?
@janinko Why to make some parameters mandatory? It is filtering, so it is up to the user/use-case. I'd keep all optional. It doesn't hurt and makes the usage more flexible.
because of KISS

I think that the Optionals do not make it somehow unreadable and the endpoint is more flexible this way. But if it sure that it won't be used any other way then it wouldn't make much sense to keep it optional.
@janinko If it is optional, it is simple, isn't it? :-)
For the version list read by DA we will specify all the params everytime, but for a different use-case in the future I would not limit it by making the params mandatory.
Ok, I will leave them optional
